parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To seize, snatch, obtain by robbery. From a derivative of haireomai; to seize.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Paradise. Of Oriental origin; a park, i.e., an Eden.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Not to be uttered (because too sacred), secret, unspeakable, unspoken. Unsaid, i.e. inexpressible.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural

str2: A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular

str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
